question1.accessibility: Question 1. This question has 4 possible answer(s) to chose from. The question has 1 correct answer(s). The controls for the knowledge check are as follows: To select the first option press 1 on the keyboard, to select the second option, press 2, the third 3, the fourth 4, and if there is a fifth 5. To submit your answer choice, select Enter on the keyboard. If you incorrectly answered the question, press Shift-Enter to reset your selections.
question1.question: How can the What Could Happen Insights feature help an Einstein Analytics consultant with analysis and discovery?
question1.option1text: It displays existing data from past transactions to help the consultant understand dashboards that have been created.
question1.option1textexplanation: Incorrect. Analyzing past transactions does not help a consultant understand dashboards that have been created.
question1.option2text: It uses data to statistically calculate probable outcomes of future events.
question1.option2textexplanation: Correct. Einstein Discovery conducts predictive analysis to predict future outcomes, and prescriptive analysis to suggest ways in which to improve those outcomes.
question1.option3text: It determines what data should be excluded from the dataset.
question1.option3textexplanation: Incorrect. What Could Happen insights do not analyze the dataset to determine what fields should be excluded from predictive analysis.
question1.option4text: It summarizes data from the past and gives the consultant performance information about the dashboards.
question1.option4textexplanation: Incorrect. What Could Happen insights do not determine dashboard performance.

question2.accessibility: Question 2. This question has 4 possible answer(s) to chose from. The question has 1 correct answer(s).
question2.question: When preparing data for predictive analytics, how can an Einstein Analytics consultant address the data quality issue of missing values?
question2.option1text: Filling in the missing values with the word “empty” will create unnecessary additional values that do not address the data quality.
question2.option1textexplanation: Incorrect. Fill in the missing values with the word “empty”.
question2.option2text: If you filter out records with missing values, you could be missing the pattern within the missing data or possibly undermine the real-world aspects in your analysis.
question2.option2textexplanation: Incorrect. Create a filter to remove all records that are missing any data in any field.
question2.option3text: Filling in missing values with other trending information from other records will skew the results.
question2.option3textexplanation: Incorrect. Fill in the missing values with trending information from other records.
question2.option4text: This is the most efficient way to cleanse and prepare your data for Einstein Analytics.
question2.option4textexplanation: Correct. Reduce the standard deviation by introducing a mean value or remove records with missing values (only if the records don’t impact the analysis).
